com.inqwell.any.channel

Interface OutputChannel

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Any, Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AnyChannel

    public interface OutputChannel
extends Any
    An output channel defines the interface by which one thread may send output to another. Such a thread is known as the producer thread.

    The OutputChannel interface defines one half of any concrete implementation and serves to reinforce the fact that a channel is unidirectional. A given channel object will be used for output from the producer thread and input to the consumer thread and should be passed to these threads as the appropriate interface.

    See Also:
    com.inqwell.any.InputChannel

    • Method Detail

      • write

        void write(Any a)
    throws AnyException
        Send (or wait until send is possible) data to the channel

        According to implementation, writers may block when the channel becomes full, or an exception is thrown

        Parameters:
        a - The item to write to the channel
        Throws:
        AnyIOException - write to full channel, or some other IO error occurred.
        AnyException

      • close

        void close()
    throws AnyException
        Close this channel. The following semantics apply:
        • Any data still waiting to be read from the channel remains available and will be returned by subsequent calls to read().
        • Once the channel has been emptied subsequent calls to read() generate a ChannelClosedException.
        • Whether or not the channel contains data, any subsequent calls to write() generate a WriteClosedChannelException.
        Note: this method is also defined on the interface InputChannel. Either readers or writers can close a channel with the same results.
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • sendPurge

        void sendPurge()
        throws AnyException
        Causes any remaining data at the input side of the channel to be discarded. The channel remains open and new data can subsequently be sent.
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • purgeReceived

        void purgeReceived(boolean close)
            throws AnyException
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • isClosed

        boolean isClosed()
        Check if this channel has been closed. If the channel has been closed any write will generate a WriteClosedChannelException.
        Returns:
        true if the channel has been closed

      • setKeepOpen

        void setKeepOpen(boolean keepOpen)
        Requests that this channel driver try to maintain its connection where connection parameters are known.

      • setSessionId

        void setSessionId(Any sessionId)
        Assign a session id to the connection represented by this channel. May be used to restore a virtual connection with a new physical one.

      • flushOutput

        void flushOutput()
          throws AnyException
        Perform any operation required to complete any output pending on this channel driver.
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • resetOutput

        void resetOutput(ChannelDriver d)
          throws AnyException
        Reset this channel's output stream. Tells the channel that the output stream must be re-established with the given ChannelDriver, the existing one being reset in in some way, if required.
        Throws:
        AnyException

      • hasPendingOutput

        boolean hasPendingOutput()
        Determine whether this channel has data waiting to be delivered on restoration of a physical connection.

      • getTotalIn

        long getTotalIn()
        Return the total number of bytes sent so far on this channel before compressing. Only relevant when the underlying channel driver supports compression and is operating in compressed mode.
        Returns:
        the total number of compressed bytes sent or -1 if not setup for output or not compressing.

      • getTotalOut

        long getTotalOut()
        Return the total number of bytes sent so far on this channel after compressing. Only relevant when the underlying channel driver supports compression and is operating in compressed mode.
        Returns:
        the total number of uncompressed bytes sent or -1 if not setup for output or not compressing.

      • getSessionId

        Any getSessionId()
